title: "What is the 'I AM Exercise' and how does it lead to the 'Not-I-I'?"
first_phrase: This text outlines exercises to help transcend the observer-observed dyad and access the "I AM" state. Before this, the author discusses how we often go blank when asked about the observer behind our experience. The last part includes Exercise #6, which prompts individuals to let go of thoughts, emotions and memories while answering questions about themselves. The questions are designed to lead towards the experience of "Not-I-I." Through this exercise, individuals explore their existence and worthiness without relying on surface-level perceptions.
content: Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, Is this personality always there, does it come and go or neither? 4. Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, Are you the thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, do they appear and then disappear in the VOID or neither? 78 ________________ I AM EXERCISE #6 FROM I AM TO NOT-I-I Exercise (to be done individually or in a group) Let your eyes close. Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, is there something wrong with you, nothing wrong with you, or neither? 'Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, are you worthy, unworthy or neither? Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, do you have an ability to do, an inability to do or neither? Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, are you inadequate, adequate or neither? Without using your thoughts, memory, emotions, associations or perceptions, do you exist, not exist or neither?
last_phrase: In conclusion, the I AM TO NOT-I-I exercise prompts the individual to explore their sense of self outside of their thoughts, memory, emotions, associations, and perceptions. By accessing a deeper understanding of their true nature, the individual can release limiting beliefs and create a more empowered and fulfilling life experience.
